item.title: Fly tipping location which keeps getting bigger, 19th June
item.description:
Seems to be a flytipping hot spot over the years. Current the piles has been growing for the last few weeks. Someones obviously had a flat refurbishment and throw it away.

item.title: Rocking manhole cover Druid street turning southbound onto tower bridge road, 19th June
item.description:
I reported this a few days ago but got the wrong manhole !! The actual noisy manhole is the tiny one turning southbound left from Druid street to tower bridge road and is reflecting a slight green light in the pictures attached! Every time a van drives over this (which is hundreds of times an hour day AND night!) it rocks very loudly and my bedroom window is literally less than a few feet away. Thank you and I apologise for the incorrect report from a couple of days!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 182, Tower Bridge Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple bins clogging up pavement, 19th June
item.description:
Outside 11 Rodwell Road seems to be the dumping ground for other peoples bins. I am the occupier of 11. There are two bins clearly marked for number 11 (bins shared between me and my neighbours) but there are about three other bins and six - seven food waste bins when there should only be two. I have tried moving them but don’t want to leave them outside of someone else’s house and just move the problem. Clearly they are not being used by residents on the street so can unmarked bins please be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Rodwell Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public access from High St Bromley via the northern end of The Glades to Queens Gds and Kentish Way obstructed by locked doors., 18th June
item.description:
Right of way between High St Bromley and Queens Gardens via The Glades shopping centre reportedly obstructed again but FMS says it is not a Council matter. I have just read this anonymous report below and believe it to have been erroneously closed. I also found this important route closed about 25 years ago, complained and got the route reopened. I believe that The Glades was built over a public right of way, or a planning condition was to retain this walking route. Otherwise, it is a very long way around including for the elderly or disabled persons. FMS Bromley does not allow another party to add a comment, so I have to raise this as a new report. Please contact the Council PROW, Planning or Legal Dept to confirm this route should always be open and the Glades doors en-route kept unlocked. Access to the rest of The Glades is secured by large shutters. Original report... Right of way from Market Square through Glades to Queens Gardens Reported via mobile in the Public Right of Way footpath category anonymously at 08:28, Saturday 14 June 2025 Sent to Bromley Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 7707963. I understood there to be a right of way through Glades when shopping center closed. Haven't used for a number of years but tried to go through yesterday night and found locked. Has this access been removed? Updates Thank you for your report, this is now being investigated. Information on our services and the timeframes we aim to respond in can be found: http://www.bromley.gov.uk/ fixservices State changed to: In progress Posted by Bromley Council at 08:29, Saturday 14 June 2025 We have investigated this report and assessed the issue is not the responsibility of Bromley Council. This could be

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
